p: Coronaviruses belongs to the subfamily Coronavirinae (order: Nidovirales, family: Coronaviridae), which are enveloped and spherical viruses with a single-stranded RNA genome [ 1, 2]. The recent outbreak of the novel beta-coronavirus responsible for COVID-19 in Wuhan, China, is probably associated with a seafood market. According to WHO situation report 148, there had been 7,941,791 confirmed cases of COVID-19 globally by 16 June 2020, resulting in 434,796 deaths. According to Zhou et al., the genome sequence of the novel virus responsible for COVID-19 (denominated SARS-CoV-2) is 96.2% similar to the genome of bat coronavirus RaTG13, while it shares 79.5% similarity with SARS-CoV [ 3]. However, compared to SARS-CoV, the human to human transmission of SARS-CoV-2 is much faster, which has already resulted in its spread around the world [ 4â€“ 6] and led the WHO to declare the outbreak as a global pandemic on 11 March 2020 [ 7].
